description: This little deli / cafe is doing great sandwiches. I had the turkey & cranberry on dutch crunch very tasty throw in the fact that it cost me $8.10 in SF or anywhere for that matter wow! I'll be back for the meatball sandy next time.
author: Sean K.

description:
I'm all about hot and comforting when it comes to Friday lunches. When picking a spot for our weekly office lunch, I decided to try Bite Me Sandwiches. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Friday, July 28th around 12 noon.

I got the San Fran: Chicken breast, bacon, avocado, jack cheese, mayo, mustard, Mojo (special garlic sauce, contains mayo) lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, onions, banana peppers, and pepperoncini on Sliced Sourdough ($13.35) and Chips: Zesty Jalapeno ($2.45). I loved all the ingredients in the sandwich, but I wanted more filling. I love giant sandwiches since I'm not the biggest bread person. Also, I felt like the sandwich was a little dry. The chicken was actually pieces of chicken breast, so it needed more sauce or something for added moisture. The chips were your standard kettle cooked chips. Nice and crunchy. A coworker of mine also ordered the Macaroni Salad ($4.05 small). I had a bite and enjoyed it with some hot sauce. She loved it and finished the whole thing.

Glad I was able to try Bite Me. Plus, who doesn't love the name of this place?! But do I want to bite into them again? Probably not. There are better sandwich shops out there.
author: Elena N.

description:
Hey. Bite Me.  :)

Good sandwiches are hard to come by.
Especially if you are not a big sandwich person like me.
Often I look at sandwiches and no matter how well it's made all I see is .. bread, a few slices of meat and fixings and I think... I am paying what for this?

But hey, bite me. you did a great job.

Partially because I always order your monster sized sandwiches (fav is the "Mile High")... but your sandwiches have plenty of meat, plenty of fixings. Your dutch crunch is good, and generally I feel pretty good after having one of your sandwiches.

Your place isn't a place to write home about or a romantic place to take a date (or a friend, or anyone).. but hey you do well in what counts - the sandwiches.

Until next time!
Bite me!


- that logo of that mouthpiece gots to go tho... scary.
author: Paul L.

description: Great sandwiches. Super fresh and big portions. Made my own with Turkey, provolone and sauerkraut with everything on it. One of the best sandwiches I've had. Great spot to pick up a sandwich and walk to Dolores Park.
author: Emma D.

description:
I have been going to Bite Me since they opened on 17th St.
Mighty dam good sandwich, you tell them or call them, it's made just the way you ordered it. I drive there from South City. Well worth the ride.
author: Greg R.

description: is a small place but they have a lot of different sandwiches, i always make my own but there are more than 15, friendly staff and quick and i really like the banana peppers. I think is the best option for sandwiches on Castro
author: Javier I.

description:
Great sandwich shop with huge list of options. I ordered the San Fran. Aside from the Dutch crunch bread being perfectly toasted, their garlic spread is better than Ike's. 

No line either. 

Notice how all the low reviews are people who ordered delivery through some other service. Maybe they should review the delivery service and not the sandwich ship. Armatures!
author: Evan S.

description:
I can't believe no one has reviewed this place yet! Don't be nervous, it's still open. Not sure about the hours but on Sat it opens 11am.

I've been the one on 16th St but it had been a long time. This time I got the Hawaiian - ham, pineapple, brie, marinara (as is - no other toppings). I wasn't sure about the marinara sauce but once hubby bit into it it he was like "Oh! This is just like a Hawaiian pizza!". Ding! Ding! Ding! We have a winner! So if you like Hawaiian pizza then you should definitely try this sandwich.

We also split a Tomcat - pastrami, bacon, avocado, cream cheese - with everything on it. But with everything on it you couldn't taste what was so special about it.

Definitely want to come back and try other combos but will hold all the extras.
author: Jean K.

description:
EVENT: just trying to find some coffee during he midday... can't find anywhere else that accepts cards.. and I found this place! Perfect!

SERVICE: lady looked at me weird when I just said I want coffee and nothing else... like forreals.. judging me hard! Can't help it... ya'll know I'm a coffee addict like everyone else here!

DRINKS: coffee... since it's midday... and it's pretty much a sandwich shop... they didn't have coffee ready.. it's cool... I guess I'll sit here and chill for a bit since I'm not in a rush... but I do need coffee!

OVERALL: maybe next time... I'll try the sandwiches! Looks yum and def get some more coffee here.. one size $2!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
How wonderfully good and affordable!! It's like a New York sandwich shop in the midst of the opulent Castro! The sandwiches are fresh and Yum, the place is cozy for a quick bite or pick up, and the staff are kind and friendly! 

I'm supporting a booth at the Castro Street fair and needed something to hold me over. I literally got a sandwich for breakfast at 10, then came back at 4 for another cause I knew the food was great, at the right price and There'd be a place to sit away from the crowds. I don't visit the Castro often and I will remember this sandwich shop the next time I'm here!
author: Fresh E.

description: Worth the short walk up 18th st from Castro, they have over 35 kinds of sandwiches and a variety of baked goods and drinks! Mine was delicious! Service prompt and courteous, prices reasonable.
author: bob B.

description: i really like this place, they have like 30 different sandwiches, my favorite is Johny Roast Beef( hot barbecue beef with cheese and you can add whatever you want) the place is quiet not really busy!!!
author: Patrick S.

description:
My sister was finishing off her top sandwiches list and I was there for the finale (I THINK this is the list: http://sfist.com/2014/12/04/the_30_best_sandwiches_in_san_franc.php )

We got there at 11am on a Sat. and were prepared to split 2 sandwiches The Love affair and the BBQ meatball. Unfortunately, the turkey they roast everyday was not going to be ready for 1 hour, so we had to choose another one, we chose the Italian. Critical error in choosing the sourdough roll for both, it was too hard a roll (especially for the meatballs) and my ingredients kept "splooshing" out.

They have a wide array of chips and fountain soda on tap.  The customer service was excellent, they were very sorry about the turkey.  The space is really nice for a sandwich shop (so is the bathroom).

I do love a sandwich, and while they were not in my top 10 SF sandwiches, I would not hesitate to return.
author: Amy W.

description:
A-OK.

Sandwiches here are decent. 
They don't include lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, etc. unless you ask for it. 
The turkey is a bit dry and the bread is sometimes TOO toasted. 

This place is only an option for me because it's relatively cheap and there usually isn't a long line during lunch.
author: Leilani Y.

description:
I love this place, I always come in and get the Rico Suave. You do have to ask for additional items on your sandwich if you want lettuce, tomatoes, pickles etc. It says on the menu however - so you shouldn't be caught off guard if you get your sandwich with none of those items.

I find the food to be really good here, and good prices for the portions. My only complaint is that they are pretty cheap with the avocado. When you pay extra you should get a good amount, it hardly ever seems like its enough. Other than that I would def recommend.
author: Rebecca F.

description:
More like an Ike's than a Jimmy John's where amazing bread, homemade spreads and great toppings steal the show.  When you see a bunch of meat listed on sandwich, you may think you're getting a cold cut monster like the J.J. Gargantuan, but the meat portions never get absurd.  Probably better for your blood pressure and cholesterol in the long run.

Abe: Simply Pastrami & Swiss Cheese.  This is *not* your typical NY-style deli pastrami.  It is thinly sliced, a modest portion and loaded with tons of fixings.  With all the other toppings going on, it was hard to really appreciate the meat as distinctly pastrami instead of just some random cold cut.  It was tasty for sure, just leave your fixed pastrami notions at the door.

Italian Hoagie: Four types of Italian cold cuts (ham, prosciutto, mortadella, salami), but didn't seem like an overwhelming amount of meat.  With all the flavorful toppings *and* a big splash of Italian dressing, the meat was overshadowed a bit.  Loved the holistic flavor profile, but far from a gut buster.
author: Adam B.

description:
Great sandwiches and nice staff.  But they have been closed twice now in the middle of the day for no reason.  We are going to have to go somewhere else to get lunch.  The hours are listed at 10am to 6pm, but they seem to close for no reason at random times.  It is noon for crying out loud.  It is lunch time! 

So if you are headed over here I suggest you call first because they don't understand that if you want loyal customers you gotta keep the doors open when you say you will.  I'm quite disappointed.  The castro finally got a decent place to get sandwiches and Bite Me is going to end up out of business if they keep this up.
author: Christopher A.

description: The sandwiches are just OK, place is slow and inefficient, to top it off the owner has an attitude problem. This is pretty clear in his responses on Yelp. There's way better sandwich shops in the city to waste money on this place. Doubt they will be around long at their new location. Bite me.
author: Kyle S.

description:
I have only been here once over a weekend in the late afternoon. 

I am a vegetarian so I have choices and it is pretty cheap. But they are slow for a non-crowded place. 

I ordered Caprese and it was ok. I have had better and I wouldn't get it again.
author: Hiral P.

description:
I come here all the time.  Best sandwiches in the city!  Though, the older lady who had my order nailed is gone now!  :(

#27 (The Hitman) w/ marinara - do eeeet!
author: Andrew N.

description: Amazing sandwiches.  I'd choose this place over Ike's or other local sandwich shops any day.
author: Chris J.

description: Ordered the basic turkey sandwich. She kept trying to upsell me and I kept saying no. Finally agreed to have her assistant make it. Took forever. The sign states "all sandwiches served hot". Well it was put in a toaster oven but aside from the outside of the bread it was not hot. Over abundance of shredded lettuce and really the turkey had no flavor at all except for pepper. I mean no salt just pepper. PLUS the sandwich board has outdated prices. Expect to pay a dollar or more on top of their posted prices.
author: John G.

description:
Truly delicious and well thought out sandwiches.  Probably the best in the hood.  The Italian hoagie is killer with some great Italian dressing and not an overwhelming amount of meat, all thinly sliced.  

Only negative is the cash only status, which they said is temporary.  I had to dig through drawers to find a couple 5's.
author: Scott H.

description: I ordered a pastrami from Kim. She was super polite and friendly. The food came fast and was delicious. Great neighborhood spot.
author: Graham G.

description: Wow, I love all the sandwiches I had so far.  Filling & tasty,  I come here every opportunity I get.
author: Serg L.

description: Don't go here if you're in a hurry. Up to 30 minutes wait time. Took them 5 minutes to even take our orders and then you get a "it will be ready in 15 minutes". Turned out more like 25. Their sandwich ideas are creative but their order taking is erratic (sticky notes that fall into the sandwich ingredients). Sandwich taste was ok but only because I ordered all the veggies. People are friendly enough and trying but they desperately need a streamlined production process. Won't go back.
author: Roland S.

description:
Decent food.
Be prepared to wait.
If I was you I would bring a coloring book.
Placed an order one hour ago showed up to the restaurant and had to wait an additional 20 minutes.
Food was really good however service was very very slow.
author: Jermaine E.

description:
I wanted to like this place after reading the reviews. An Ike's challenger. But my sandwich was underwhelming. 

I ordered the Whatever Brian Wilson. Turkey, cranberry, shiracha, and jack cheese on a Dutch crunch. The sandwich was pressed and served hot. My disappointment when I unwrapped it was the sandwich was as described. 

No veggies, like lettuce, tomatoes, and even jalapeños. The turkey was flaked, like tuna. The cranberry sauce with the shiracha added the flavor to the sandwich. But it was a lot that it was too much. I couldn't even taste nor find the jack cheese.  The only good thing was that it was not large in size. So I didn't feel like I set a gut bomb. 

Maybe I ordered the wrong sandwich from their many offerings. But with all the places to visit, it may be awhile till I revisit.
author: Marck N.

description:
Pretty good. It did take a while to get our sandwiches but there's something about this place that makes it worthwhile. This neighborhood has changed a lot over the last couple years in terms of gentrification but that doesn't always mean it's a change for the better.

The owners and staff were very nice. I'm looking forward to going back.
author: Emmett K.

description:
The sandwiches are good -- not as good as Ike's.  They specialize in sandwiches and there are many different ones to choose from (just like Ike's) 
I had the San Fran on a sour roll.  They toast the roll which makes it very crunchy and hard.  The chicken was over cooked which made it dry and tough.  My recommendation is to tell them not to toast the bread hopefully that way the chicken won't seem overcooked.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Very good! A lof of different kind of sandwiches, cool ambiance and welcoming.

I had the Godfather sandwich with avocado extra, it was really good and for a good price.
author: Léo D.

description:
It's great that there's a sandwich place in the Castro even though my favorite sandwich place is up on Polk. 
I was craving a sandwich & a friend suggested Bite Me. 
It was mid afternoon & Bite Me was empty. Only one person ahead of me. The woman at the counter is super friendly.  Really very nice. 
But unfortunately the sandwich was not good. A total bomb.  Something didn't taste right. It has the slightest sour taste to it, & I didn't feel so great right after I ate it. As in, I had to drink some Coke to diminish that oogy feeling. 
I most likely won't be going back, or I might try something different there if I'm dying for a sandwich.
author: Reed S.

description: They've moved so I don't get their sandwiches anywhere near as often anymore (or at all), but I was always really fond of the Italian on Dutch crunch without mustard. Gonna miss the convenience of their previous location, but will hopefully find a convenient way of visiting them where they are now!
author: Tom L.

description:
This is a legit sandwich spot! The sandwich options are broad, the ingredients they use are fresh and tasty, their turkey is super delicious (it is actual roast turkey as compared to lunch meat), and they are affordable! The staff is friendly and the seating area is chill and relaxing. It's a nice, humble spot that will definitely fulfill anyone's craving for a super delicious sandwich. They also toast their bread which is awesome! 

I had the Hangover with no ham and added jalapeños on a toasted soft white bun and it was a super solid sandwich! Love this spot!
author: Tyrone A.

description:
A decent lunch spot... 

It's very close to the office & every time we come here we like our sandwiches (they are on the bigger side so you can split it if you aren't super hungry). 

At this time my FAVs are #19 Fat Belly = turkey, pastrami, jack cheese, nacho cheese chips (I think Doritos) on soft French roll & (under Veggie Sandwiches) The Big Cheese = Brie, jack cheese, avocado, nacho cheese chips on soft French roll. I think I might like nacho cheese chips in my sandwiches... 

I have also tried the Rico Suave, Tomcat, Veggie delight and all were pretty good.

The staff is friendly all the time & if you are on a time crunch this is not the place for "fast food" they take their time making your food. Knowing that we aren't ever dissatisfied with the service.

p.s. I saw a few reviews that this place doesn't include lettuce, tomatoes, or any veggies (I totally believe it) but from my personal experience I have always had veggies included in all my sandwiches without having to ask.
author: Candice P.

description:
Just had one of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time - roast beef with cheddar on sliced wheat, cold.  Sounds simple, but it hit the spot, without the stomachache I usually get from sandwich shop sandwiches. (Say that quickly 3 times!)

Staff is friendly and accommodating. A nice addition to this area!
author: M G.

description: Terrible experience. The owner was very rude and outright abusive to customers. The service was intolerably slow (30mins+ for a single sandwich). The interior is very dingy and unpleasant. Avoid at all costs.
author: Alex K.

description:
Here what I liked: 
-there were a lot of options for sandwiches
-place looked relatively clean
Woman offered my cup of water
Here's what I didn't like:
-Took her 15 min to get my order. The woman in the front was so slow. I was the only one in line. When I named a sandwich on the wall, she looked confused. Her son had to save the day. Very frustrating experience.
-got chicken instead of turkey on my "Sensitive Sammy" 
-Sourdough did not taste fresh.
-Did not seem very friendly
-had a sandwich on the wall called "Ike Who?" (How arrogant) 
On a side note Ike's Place is a million times better.

Don't come here expecting excellence.
author: Steven G.

description: Sandwiches are meh (dry, not creative). Also, the staff are incredibly rude. I have a medical condition that causes dehydration and they refused to give me water. The owner apparently doesn't believe me, which adds insult to injury. Please please avoid this place.
author: Emily F.

description:
We ordered the Love Affair sandwiches to be delivered to our workplace from Grubhub. Sandwich was $6.75 but with delivery I paid over $12. I just couldn't wait to try out this sandwich since my coworker was raving about it. And it sounded good with the salt & vinegar chips and the brie cheese in the sandwich. 

As requested, we wanted the lettuce, tomato and pickles separate in another container cause we were afraid it would get soggy by the time we get them. It was nice since they gave us alot of the condiments. I thought they could've put more turkey though. I don't see the brie cheese at all and I don't taste much of it. And what's up with the salt and vinegar chips? It's missing! All four of the sandwiches were missing that key ingredient that was mentioned on the menu.

The sandwich was mediocre at best and can tell it was missing something. I had to get some Kettle salt and vinegar chips to add to the sandwich to make it taste better. I would've given 3-4 stars if it wasn't missing the chips. Even my coworker who has ordered before many time and raved about that sandwich said he was disappointed also. Next time he is going to order at the place in person to make sure nothing is missing. Skip ordering online.
author: Wil W.

description:
Just got ham and provolone on a double crunch roll with all the normal fixins and loved it. Service was good and I like the extensive and humorous menu. The only thing I didn't like about the place was that it was really warm inside.

I prefer the mom and pop sandwich places like Bite Me. It's the same as Ike's and Rhea's without the long wait. The Sandwich Place on Mission and the Guerrero Market and Deli are also great for sandwiches.
author: Xteethx B.

description:
2 stars for having the best sandwiches in the city. 

-3 stars for completely screwing me on my Postmates delivery *every time*. You list that sandwiches include lettuce, tomato, mayo... All that stuff. You don't include it. I even typed in every topping I wanted this time. And I still get NOTHING. Basically I just paid $8 for a piece of bread. Never doing delivery again. Wasted way too much money in the HOPES that I would have my favorite sandwich. I will spend my money elsewhere.
author: rachel s.

description: Liked this place when it was on 18th St in the Castro. Put in an online order that was supposed to be ready by 11:30. Stopped by at noon and the sole guy working here, who admitted to the previous customer that he didn't even show up to work on time, is just now scrambling to put the order together. Will not order from here again. :(
author: Yannan S.

description:
Bite Me sucks.  Seriously.  I've had the BBQ chicken ordered for me twice by my work, and yet while the menu says all sandwiches come with lettuce tomato pickles and more, inexplicably my sandwich has arrived with just chicken and BBQ sauce and NO TOPPINGS each time.  Plus, the chicken was dry and overcooked and the bread was stale.  Not good.

Also, I tried coming here on my lunch break once during posted hours at about ten minutes to close only to find the place already locked up and done.  

Go to MR PICKLES.
author: eric i.

description: The menu here is awesome but I've never experienced slower service in my life.  It's a Sunday morning and the lady working the front has one other customer ordering two sandwiches.  I had to wait 10 minutes before she would even take my order.  This other poor soul had to wait 15 minutes before she even got around to poring him a simple cup of coffee. Not worth the wait.
author: Ene S.

description: This place was horrible. I don't know where these other reviewers ate, but it wasn't the Bite Me I went to. We ordered a Reuben and a BBQ Chicken. They forgot our order for 10 minutes then slapped something together. The BBQ Chicken barely had any chicken on it, and the bread was stale and tasted weird. The Reuben was actively disgusting. The coleslaw was slimy, the bread cheap and soggy, they put a cheap mayonnaise on it that tasted sour (why would you even need it with Thousand Island??)'. They had barely toasted, it because they forgot it, so the cheese was half melted and lukewarm. With the cold sauerkraut, it was a gross, slimy, sour mess. I'm so disappointed that I got tricked into going there by the good reviews.
author: Drew G.

description:
It tries to be like Ike's. It's cheaper than Ike's. But it's no Ike's. Just to compare, I tried one of their sandwiches which was supposed to be a knock-off of the Menage-a-Trois (they even had the word "Ike" in that sandwich's name.. forgot what it was called though). It just didn't taste right. The combination of the sauces just didn't have that addicting flavor. The pepperoncinis completely didn't go with the rest of the ingredients and ruined the flavor combination.

The sandwiches are just okay.. but it's a clear case of Ike-envy here.
author: Kazu O.

description:
I'm a big sandwich fan so anytime a new place opens up in SF I need to try it out.  Bite Me is kind of in an odd location so if you're looking to drive and park you're probably better off trying somewhere else.

Luckily I was able to get a spot and got my sandwich quickly.  I ordered the Italian Hoagie on a soft roll and it was pretty good.  Nothing too out of the ordinary on the good or bad side but a decent sandwich.

I'd be curious to try out some of their other sandwiches to see if it sways my position one way or the other.
author: Blake B.

description: Randomly, my second day in a row eating here. It's probably the best deli around SF for taste, speed and ample places to sit and eat.
author: Mark Y.

description:
The Danny Zuko, on toasted dutch crunch with everything plus cranberry, is one of the best sandwiches in the city.

The staff is friendly and the owner is a very nice guy.  We used to go here twice a week when it was located on 17th and South Van Ness.  The new location is a little out-of-the-way, but still worth it.
author: Nam K.

description:
Great spot yummy sandwiches friendly service, I like having the option to modify my san fran
Thanks, Chillywill.
author: William S.

description:
Haven't had a sandwich this good in a long time! I recommend the #5: Love Affair!

Fast service. And lots of options! And the Rosemary & olive oil chips are amazing!
author: Jimmy G.

description: I had a hot turkey sandwich and everything was made too perfection, this was my first time having them and there better than safeway
author: Krystel C.

description: The San Francisco sandwich on a Dutch roll was super. One sandwich can feed two people.
author: Morris R.

description: This is one of the best sandwiches of my life ! Fresh, real food !! Chicken is so tasty. Bread is freash and toasted. I got the San Fran and it was amazing, left off the mayo, mustard, opted for their house garlic spread, left out the tomato, pickles,  banana peppers,  , If you're in the Castro, stop here , really delicious food .
author: Mario G.

description: Had the #21 sandwich, the San Francisco. It was warm and melted in your mouth. The owner's mom was working the register and was a gem. Highly recommended!
author: Mike J.

description:
Eating all the sandwiches. #6

http://sfist.com/2014/12/04/the_30_best_sandwiches_in_san_franc.php

Thursday, February 19, 2015

I got here at 11:45. There was only one person in the place.

Me - Yes! No waiting in line! Sweet.

There were two dudes behind the counter. One did obviously not want to help me at all. I couldn't tell if he was actually working there or not. The other guy finally came over and was friendly.

I ordered the Danny Zuko as recommended on Sour Dough. (I'm sorry people, I just don't like Dutch Crunch. Hate on haters.) I asked for it with mustard and he said it comes with everything, question mark. Me - yes, everything. Then he listed everything off which I found reassuring and made me more convinced I wanted it all.

spoiler - I want it all.

I took the sandwich to go. It was nice and warm in my hands. Ate it at the office, all of it. Every last bite. The turkey was nice and fresh, not sliced. It was juicy but not overly so. It dripped on the wax paper, but not on my desk. Always appreciated. After finishing the first half I went for the second. Very full, but not in an uncomfortable way. It was spicy, but with just enough kick to be spicy and no lingering pain. Really good all around. I'd go back and try something else for sure.

Not a five though. Really solid sandwich. Nice service once the right guy came over, good menu, nice ingredients, but I didn't moan out loud or embarrass myself or anything which means it was excellent, but not orgasmic.
author: A. T.

description:
If I ran a sandwich place and half the people were yelping about how mediocre (or worse) my sandwiches were, I'd fucking pay attention. The sandwiches are uninspired (just putting a wacky name on a sandwich doesn't make it good) and poorly-balanced (I had the mojo sauce, wing sauce, pepperoncini, pickles and some other acidic thing on my "Art School"... it was such an acidic sour bomb that I don't even need to complain about the dried out, tasteless chicken breast). Ingredients are generic quality and stingy. 

If you go here, try to get something as basic as possible... they really need to up their game. Really, how hard can it be to make a great sandwich?
author: Michael B.

description: I mistakenly ordered online for this location and the owner was so gracious to help us out! I have to say, this place gives Ike's a run for their money! Their sandwiches are not only delicious but super affordable (and huge!). I would give 6 stars if I could, definitely give them a try!
author: Kelly T.

description:
Today I ordered on the EAT 24 app...my sandwich took 20 min longer than the proposed time. Therefore, I only had 7 min to eat for lunch. I really think they put my sandwich on hold because a person who ordered their sandwich at the shop got hers right after mine. I ordered my sandwich about 40 minutes before she did. 

Also, there were previous encounters with that shop that had made some of my co-workers not want to go there and eat. The customer service can be bad sometimes. However, the young guy and the young woman who sometimes work there are nice. 

I give it two stars because their sandwiches are good.
author: C V.

description: Awesome little sandwich shop. There was no line and the woman working inside was so nice and helpful. Sandwich tasted delicious. Not to mention the prices are just right!!!!
author: Alesia M.

description:
I can say that after a half a sandwich it is the best I've had for subs since I was a kid (I haven't tried Ike's).  Far beyond Jimmy John's fake bread and cheap processed tasting turkey.
This turkey is chunky and shredded - real turkey!

Big enough for two meals if you don't eat much like me!

They don't automatically put mayo on it if you do build your own and the tomatoes were sparse, but otherwise I like!
author: D H.

description:
Probably the oddest sandwich shop I have tried. 

First visit - walked in, only one other customer in the corner, smelled some odd odor that consumed the entire shop, but figured it was an anomaly. I ordered the Axel Foley (I do like the movie genre names for their food) - and took it back to work. 

The AF is hot links and pastrami w/jack cheese. The hot links were so-so, and there was so little pastrami it's hard to make a judgement. 

Second and last visit - walked in, again into a cloud of some unknown odor that can suppress your appetite - not sure was it was. This time I tried the Dude Abides - meatball with bbq sauce and cheddar cheese. When I asked if I could swap the cheddar for mozzarella, I was chastised and told I needed to stick with what they came up with -I just obliged out of just being stunned. It was fairly bland, nothing special - I think the bbq sauce is just something out of safeway. 

No thanks Bite Me - I tried, twice - too many other places to sample.
author: Tom C.

description:
I've been to Bite Me Sandwiches several times and always have to end up getting the more basic sandwiches, because the most complex ones don't have any vibrant flavor at all. Also, their service is terribly slow. Therefore, I always end up ordering by phone and in advance the simple ham and cheese.

These sandwiches are nothing specially unique or original, when it comes to flavor. Their location is now worse than their previous one--they just moved to a shadier location that is dark and uninviting, farther away from my work place, the reason why I rarely go there--I only go there when I absolutely don't have any other option, which is becoming rare nowadays.
author: Raymond F.

description: Sandwich was great (Italian Hoagie). Staff is friendly and helpful with recommendations. Will be coming back next time I'm in the area.
author: John V.

description: ordered 6 sandwiches today via waiters on wheels.  The driver charged me $5 more than what was quoted to me on the website.  But the receipt I was emailed had the $5 difference and I hadn't checked that.  I assumed it would be the same price!  our order came out to over $93!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  We are all soooo very disapointed with the quality of our food, these sandwiches are way too small for what we were charged. I could have made a better sandwich at home!  None of us will order from here again, period.  for $15 per sandwich, I could have ordered something much better.  so disgusted!
author: Michael V.

description: The owner doesn't care about making a shit ton of money, he just wants to make delicious sandwiches! I highly recommend the Winnie Cooper and the Abe, also they have a good selection of beverages. It's always wonderful to see him and his sweet mother working behind the counter. This is the kind of local business I love supporting because it's guys like him that makes the Mission community so great!
author: Soo L.

description: Just ordered from Caviar. My Rico Suave chicken sandwich is just alright. I can barely taste the ranch flavor (which I was most excited about) but that might be because the Pepper Jack cheese is too spicy for my taste. Wish they would have specified that it was Pepper Jack, instead of just saying "Jack" on the menu description. There's definitely a difference between Jack and Pepper Jack cheese, probably should have warned a sister.
author: Natalie T.

description:
These guys have moved but they still have the same great sandwiches. Now, they also have beer and wine, as well as a bigger, better space to hang out. Very nice!

I'm glad to see them back in business. 

Cootz OUT!

({})
author: Cooter T.

description: Such great sandwiches. So many places in the Castro lack good, interesting choices but this shop originated in the mission and you can tell from the quality of the food. Try a Danny Z or a Mile High. All the sandwiches are awesome. Note, it's cash only and they don't have an ATM.
author: Rob M.

description: Holy cow!!  I was treated here for lunch this past week and their Italian sandwich was excellent. They have an awesome garlicky sauce that is a perfect compliment to most any sandwich.  I wish they had one of these in my town so I could go there frequently as it would easily become one of my usual eateries.  Inside is set up pretty simply but they have a large TV and serve you quickly.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
Same great solid sandwiches for the price. I like the San Fran (21) and it's still as good or better than the last location. 

They are still a little rough around the edges at this location, but that's part of the deal. You want a quick tasty sandwich, do it up.
author: Ryan F.

description:
Had the San Fran and I enjoyed it more than a Lucca's sandwich. Better than 2 Sons as well. Great that there's a quality sandwich joint so close to my work now. I'm not going to compare them to Ike's like everyone else. I gave my rating and that's enough.

I'll be back to try more sandwiches for sure.
author: Craig I.

description:
I really, really like this place. Go with the Ike Who which has chicken, avocado, bacon, honey mustard plus all the standard stuff. Get it on dutch crunch and thank me later.

They've also got a great selection of cool chips, drinks, and snacks to complete your meal.

PS, they are sometimes kind of slow making the sandwiches, so I usually call ahead.
author: Rohan N.

description:
I went to this place to get a sandwich on my lunch break. There was no one in line but like 20 people waiting for their sandwiches. The manager was back there yelling at the sandwich makers in a really disrespectful way. I waited 20 minutes for my sandwich, but it never came. 

I told the register girl that I had to go and asked for my money back. At which point, the manager stopped yelling at his staff and started yelling at me. He rushed over like he was going to attack me. He was aggressive and his behavior suggested some sort of mental illness. His eyes were bloodshoot and he yelled incoherently. 

I have nothing against those who struggle with mental illness, but I would suggest the manager learn new skills to cope with his.
author: M D.

description:
This place is awesome. If you live in the Mission and love great sandwiches (definitely on par with Ike's for SURE), try out Bite Me Sandwiches. In particular, there are 3 sandwiches that really stand out (I get lunch there about once a week). In no particular order: 

1. Avogobble. (off-menu) Simple avocado, sprouts, and turkey. Get it with everything. The turkey is made onsite same-day, none of that lunch meat crap. Delish. For an extra kick, add honey mustard. 

2. Ike Who? (off-menu) Decadent, delicious. An obvious stab at Ike's, but whatever. This sandwich is da bomb.

3. Danny Zuko. Turkey, bacon, avocado, jalapenos, and swiss cheese. It's awesome.

Get your sandwiches on Dutch Crunch, and you won't be disappointed. Great sandwich for a great price - they impress me every time. Nom!
author: Liz H.

description:
Glad they found a new spot after getting evicted by the last money-grubbing landlord. I can think of a few places that have better sandwiches than Bite Me, but they're also at least $3-4 more and teeming with patchy bearded startup dorks who hold up the line ordering for 30 of their agoraphobic coworkers at once. 

The one thing that didn't seem to survive the move was the impressive assortment of root beers that once filled their fridges. I'm not sure that the regular beer is going to pan out so well for a lunch place, so hopefully it comes back.
author: Nicholas J.

description:
Solid sandwich, price is right, portion of sandwich is great too. I had the San Fran this time, and it was quality. Off the board, I've had about 5 different sandwiches, and San Fran is my favorite, and so is the "Heat". The variety is good, and I know it's the alternative to Ike's, but I like local family owned versus a becoming chain.

The ingredients have always tasted quality, and Nadal really knows how to make a sandwich. Another good thing is they have a good selection of drinks and chips, even candies. My advice would be, there is kind of too much of a selection. The new location on 16th isn't the most visible or cleanest of areas, but the sandwich speaks for itself.
author: Howard J.

description: This is my new favorite sandwich spot, and much less of a hassle than Ike's, both in terms of wait and attitude. My favorite is the Winnie Cooper (#18) on toasted sliced wheat. The owner is a super nice guy and takes the time to engage with his customers. They look to add a burger joint upstairs, so it should be a killer 1-2 punch.
author: Josh G.

description: Love the irreverence of the sandwich names on the menu. Quick, easy, and worth every penny.
author: Robert M.

description:
Lots of great tasting sandwiches for a reasonable price.  The staff is always nice too.

My only complaint is that it's not the most charming location or space but it's very close to my office.
author: Chris S.

description: Went in for a quick bite on a busy errands day. Was quite pleasantly surprised. My sandwich was super good and very reasonably priced. I am definitely returning!
author: Cole K.

description: One of the best sandwich shops in the city!! I could eat their sandwiches every day! My favorites are Ike Who? and Danny Zuko! Delicious!
author: Jenny R.

description: I ordered a caprese sandwich with sliced sourdough bread, avocado and bacon. I am truly upset of how ridiculously small my sandwich was. The bread was soggy. The taste was not great. The sides were burnt. My sandwich came out to $15.00 Never again!!! I mean if it would have at least tasted well I would have not been as upset. Never will i recommend this place to anyone, truly disappointing. I had to end up up throwing it away.
author: Rosa H.

description: Thank you Nidal, for posting that pic.  It was clearly Caviar's fault, so I am updating my rating and will try ordering again through a different service.
author: Tracy B.

description:
had a italian hoagie on dutch crunch.  pretty good!  i'd go back to try others.  mojo sauce is tasty.  

and yes compared to other hipster sandwich places in mission, bite me is reasonably priced
author: Jeffry C.

description: Glad they found a new home close by. Love the Danny Zuko. Missing the wide selection of drinks though. But now they have beer on tap.
author: Derrick V.

description: The Yoda #10, everything on it on Dutch Crunch. If you like tuna, this is the best tuna sandwich I've ever had. I know that's boastful, but it is. They put pepperoncinis in the sandwich, just enough lettuce and tomato and their tuna salad is so good. It isn't runny, it isn't dry, just perfect. I haven't ordered anything else on the menu, but my boyfriend and old roommate love it too and they've tried a variety of sandwiches. They were around the corner from us and now their on 16th which is a little more of a hike, but worth it. I love their sandwiches!
author: Maeling D.

description: I was excited to check out this sandwich shop, but I was slightly underwhelmed by the experience. We shared a Reuben and a chicken salad sandwich. The Reuben was great, but the chicken salad had TONS of black pepper. It was really overwhelming. I'd probably come back here but I'll stay clear of the chicken salad next time. The neighborhood leaves a bit to be desired but the parking is easy.
author: Diana G.

description: This place is just as good as Ike's (if not better tbh), minus the long waits. Their BLT is probably the best I've ever had, too.
author: Morgane M.

description: New location is MUCH nicer than the old one and it's only about a block away.  There is actually decent seating at the new location too.  The size of the sandwiches they make here is perfect because I don't leave holding my stomach or unbuckling my belt.
author: Durty D.

description: This is the best sandwhich I have ever had. You must get the soft roll! So amazing!! There is never a line, which I don't understand but definitely a must try!
author: Hilary L.

description: The sandwiches are definitely a good deal. The area is a little sketch, but it's fine.
author: Nathan A.

description:
Excellent food at affordable prices. 
very friendly and cordial staff. the service is fast. Sensitive Sammy is my personal fav.
author: Nishi D.

description: One of my favorite sandwich spots!! Glad they found a new location. You can get everything from the normal to having nacho cheese Doritos on your sandwich. And, now you can grab a pint too. Check it out.
author: Seth D.

description: this opened a few blocks away from work and i have only tried one sandwich but i really really like it.  because there are doritos inside of it.  yes.  inside of the sandwich.  it also has cream cheese!  and brie!  and toasted bread!  The Big Cheese is incredibly not healthy and makes me immediately want a nap afterwards but it's a really great treat.  also the store has a million types of chips and candy--even lion bars!
author: kate s.

description: Loved the sandwich I had, and the best value (so far) in SF. My go to favorite is Lou's Cafe, but I was in this neighborhood and went in to try them out. I was there in the middle of the afternoon, and there were no other customers at the time. So, hard to evaluate loudness or how slow they might be when busy (presumably during lunch rush). I was greeted fairly quickly from the friendly counter person when I came in. I was not in a hurry, and I would describe the service (making the sandwich) as leisurely. Or perhaps she was just particular in what she was doing. I had the San Fran (chicken, avocado, bacon, jack). I always look for avocado-containing choices and they have several on the menu. The food is the reason to come. Prices are on the lower side for premium sandwiches in SF ($7-8). Loved their bread and the combo. The decor and furnishings are pretty informal/industrial/minimal. Parking can be difficult.
author: Shan H.

description: First time coming here.Did not have much choice in bread.(roll bread only had sour dough).Got the turkey pesto.I've had better tasting pesto. Would not come back again.YUUUCCCKKK...!!!
author: Chula G.

description: This spot is a joke.  Was looking for a sandwich place in the mission and come across this. Go in with my lady and she order some sandwich with chicken salad in it and the guy say sorry out of chicken salad today.  So no problem she order some kind of ham sandwich.  I go up next and order a winnie Cooper and ask for jalapeño.  He say sorry no jalapeño.  I then ask how can u run out of jalapeños in the mission, that's not possible. You have foods Co 2 blocks one way and safeway to blocks another way. But anyway this place need a experience management also. They call my name and give me just one sandwich and call me back to counter 2 min later for the other sandwich.  Who does that. Now on to the taste of the sandwich,  it was not good at all and with today being in the 80's the last thing I want is a super dry sandwich.  They would need to triple the amount of condiments used to make it tastes ok, and same also for my lady sandwich.  So the last thing that pissed me off was they used the oldest trick in the book for sandwich Makin, and that not adding no meat on both ends of the sandwich.  At least one inch on   each end was meatless.  Will never see another buck from me. Just too many things went wrong on the first shot.
author: joe w.

description: This place is the biggest joke sandwich spot . Don't let them fool you with the creative sandwiches. They are very stingy on the meat and the quality is low. So please do not waste your time with this overpriced low quality sandwich shop. Sandwiches are way below average.
author: Anthony B.
